page.title: 09The Kylesku Bridge
page.content: In August 1982 the preparations for the building of the Kylesku Bridge started. Portacabins came and with them caravans, offices, lorries, cranes, tractors and many workmen. It took a while for any progress in the building of the Â£2.75m bridge to be seen, but they were constructing a pier and supports for the legs, on the North side and the South side simultaneously. The bridge looked as if it would be made of steel, until they put shutters on it and poured concrete over it.The next stage was the construction of the centre section_ on the shore of the kyle.When completed it was winched into position and the whole deck tarred. Once finished the bridge measured in excess of 275m and gave a clearance of 24m above High Water Mark.
